snippet: Public colleges and universities that compete in N.C.A.A. Division I sports spend three to six times as much on each athlete as they do to educate students.
abstract: Report from American Institutes for Research finds that public colleges and universities that compete in NCAA Division I sports spend three to six times as much on each athlete as they do to educate students.
lead_paragraph: Public colleges and universities that compete in N.C.A.A. Division I sports spend three to six times as much on each athlete as they do to educate students.

headline.seo: Top Public Colleges in N.C.A.A. Favor Sports Over Academics
headline.main: At Many Top Public Universities, Intercollegiate Sports Come at an Academic Price
headline.print_headline: At Many Top Public Universities, Intercollegiate Sports Come at an Academic Price
